page.title: 04Industry in Canterbury
page.content: 80% of people are employed in the service{industries}and only 10% in manufacturing. Canterbury attracts a large proportion (50%) of workers from elsewhere in Kent. Another feature of {employment}is the large proportion (42%) of{jobs}occupied by females.38% of women work less than 30 hours per week. Male employment is found in the professional and technical sector, followed by sales, then engineering then transport and communication - these account for 50% of jobs. Female employment is concentrated in four areas, - clerical jobs, sales assitants,{services}and professional and technical occupations. Unemployment (8%) is not as bad as elsewhere, and the main areas for job growth are seen to exist in retailing, recreation,tourism,education,& health.
